holidays.name: Be an Angel Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to doing random acts of kindness and spreading positivity by being a 'human angel' to those around you.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday encourages people to perform selfless acts and brighten someone's day with kindness and generosity.
holidays.funFact: People often leave surprise gifts or notes for strangers as their angelic deeds on this day!

holidays.name: Tooth Fairy Day
holidays.description: A whimsical celebration honoring the legendary Tooth Fairy who exchanges children's lost teeth for money or treats.
holidays.origin: This day celebrates the beloved childhood tradition and mythical creature that visits children when they lose a baby tooth.
holidays.funFact: The Tooth Fairy tradition dates back to early European customs, evolving over centuries into the magical figure we know today.

holidays.name: National Eat a Peach Day
holidays.description: A tasty tribute to the juicy and delicious peach, encouraging everyone to enjoy this sweet summer fruit in any way they like.
holidays.origin: A food holiday that celebrates the peach’s peak season and its status as a symbol of summer’s bounty.
holidays.funFact: Peaches have been cultivated for over 4,000 years and were once considered a symbol of immortality in Chinese culture!

holidays.name: World Plant Milk Day
holidays.description: A celebration promoting plant-based milk alternatives and their benefits for health and the environment.
holidays.origin: Initiated by The Plant-Based Foods Association to raise awareness of non-dairy milk options and encourage sustainable choices.
holidays.funFact: The first commercial plant-based milk was soy milk, which originated in China over 2,000 years ago.
